messages.content: Like these cards both do extremely similar things, give me some resources next turn
In terms of those resources, prepare crush is... very odd?
You dont get any block (bad) but get an <inflame> that is already upgraded, and a little more energy than <outmanouver>

embeds.title: SLIME CRUSH!!!
embeds.description:
Special Attack / 4 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Deal 35 (40) damage (to ALL enemies).
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Im not really sure how to look at it tbh, its a 2 cost deal 39(43) next turn and exhaust card with the option of flexing to 4e next turn, but -1 hand size
Although in terms of things i want to draft, its harder to click on than the uncommon purely because it has no block on it
And the times where i do ***want*** something like this, the turn of waiting is crippling, like say in <Taskmaster>

Yeah it is really awkward doing nothing the turn of. The strength feels very unimportant, as slime boss already has ways of stacking infinite strength, and doesn't have many good strength payouts anyway.
3(4) energy next turn is really good though, and upgraded it fully pays for the slime crush+ which is pretty damn good.
overall though without an energy relic this is really bad. Maybe with pyramid so you can match it up with a non-damaging turn.
slime boss has two good strength payouts

<divide and conquer>
<leech life>
both exhaust

messages.content: Isn't there a common double hit?
<fan of knives>

embeds.title: Fan of Knives
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 5 (8) damage to ALL enemies.
Berserker **Combo:** Deals damage twice.

messages.content: I know champ has lots of double-hits
but I wanted to say all the really good strength payouts
things that hit at least thrice
or can use strength in increasing damage and something else

It's a pretty weird card. Sort of a hybrid between outmaneuver, a delayed inflame, and a delayed damage card. The key there is the delay, which is a very significant downside. It's going to be really hard to find a turn where you feel comfortable spending 2 energy doing nothing, and while the rewards are fairly good, they aren't amazing or anything. Prepare crush (the uncommon boss card that's available to everyone but slime boss), and prepare (the uncommon skill for slime boss that gives block, and a stronger next turn), are both much easier to use since the block they give helps to buy time for the delayed effect. 

Prepare crush thus ends up feeling more like doppelganger or outmaneuver, a card that doesn't do anything on the turn you draw/play it, but sets you up for a powerful turn in the future. However, it doesn't have doppelganger useful upgrade or chem X interaction, and it's both rare and more expensive than outmaneuver, which leaves it in a really awkward space. I have a very difficult time imagining taking Prepare: Crush over my other 2 rares from the boss card reward. It's at it's best with snecko eye (note that the slime crush will not be affected by snecko eye, it still costs 4) to reduce the cost, or pyramid to help play it on a safe turn. Another big difference between this and those silent cards is that your only X card is teamwork, which isn't a big payoff. Silent can get significant value out of the bonus energy with skewer, potentially more copies of doppelganger and especially malaise. Silent is also excellent at planning big turns with well-laid plans, and has significant access to card draw, which is another way to turn all that extra energy into value. Slime boss can't do any of that, and instead gets 3 strength (pretty underwhelming considering that slimes can also gives strength, and that you have very few payoffs), and a big damage card next turn.

Before talking about the slime crush part of this card, we have to mention the upgrade. It gives you 1 more energy next turn, and 5 extra damage on the slime crush, while also making it AOE. That AOE is really important, and makes prepare: crush into a fairly strong solution to several tough aoe fights, inclusind tri-sentries, slavers, gremlin leader, and reptomancer. I think that it you are taking prepare: crush, it's largely to solve your aoe fights, and that you desperately want that upgrade (which can be done immediately after at the next campfire if it's your boss card reward). It's not a perfect solution to those fights, as you are probably taking significant damage during the setup turn, but slime boss is probably one of the best characters at regenerating their health between their starting relic, several rares, and equalize, so I think it can work reasonably well. 

It's a fairly interesting card for act 1 if you can get it from a heart bonus or an early shop. The big damage on slime crush is really significant at that point in the game, especially if you can pair it with vulnerable, and can be a pretty real solution to lagavulin and gremlin nob. If you can get it upgraded, it also does really well into tri sentries, and it will kill most act 1 enemies too. You will bleed health to do this, but hopefully your starting relic can offset that. If upgraded, it remains relevant (but often more costly in terms of health) in act 2, but this will fall off very hard into acts 3 and 4. Having 4 energy, as well as efficient block cards, or good access to leeching slime and potency can really help mitigate the downside of waiting during that off turn.
